us.pserver.revok.reflect

Class Invoker

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.pserver.revok.reflect.Invoker

  • public class Invoker
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for invoking object methods using reflection.
    Version:
    1.1 - 201506
    Author:
    Juno Roesler - juno@pserver.com

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_INVOKE_TRIES
      DEFAULT_INVOKE_TRIES = 5
      Default number of tries to invoke a method in case of error.
      static java.lang.String VAR_SIGNAL
      VAR_SIGNAL = "$"
      Character used to mark a variable name on the server.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Invoker(ObjectContainer cont, Credentials cred)
      Default constructor receives the ObjectContainer with the stored object to invoke and a Credentials object for authentication.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_INVOKE_TRIES

        public static final int DEFAULT_INVOKE_TRIES
        DEFAULT_INVOKE_TRIES = 5
        Default number of tries to invoke a method in case of error. Allow greater quality results on multithreaded environments.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • VAR_SIGNAL

        public static final java.lang.String VAR_SIGNAL
        VAR_SIGNAL = "$"
        Character used to mark a variable name on the server.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Invoker

        public Invoker(ObjectContainer cont,
               Credentials cred)
        throws MethodInvocationException
        Default constructor receives the ObjectContainer with the stored object to invoke and a Credentials object for authentication.
        Parameters:
        cont - ObjectContainer with the stored object to invoke.
        cred - Credentials object for authentication.
        Throws:
        MethodInvocationException - In case of error invoking the remote method.

      • getObject

        public java.lang.Object getObject(RemoteMethod rm)
                           throws MethodInvocationException,
                                  AuthenticationException
        Get the object whose method will be invoked.
        Parameters:
        rm - Method information.
        Returns:
        The object whose method will be invoked.
        Throws:
        MethodInvocationException - In case of error invoking the method.
        AuthenticationException - In case of authentication error.

      • invoke

        public java.lang.Object invoke(RemoteMethod mth)
                        throws MethodInvocationException,
                               AuthenticationException
        Invoke a method on object.
        Parameters:
        mth - The Remote method invocation request.
        Returns:
        Objeto de retorno do m√©todo ou null no caso void.
        Throws:
        MethodInvocationException - In case an error occurs on invocation.
        AuthenticationException - If authentication fails.
